courseDescription:
Interested in building a career in website development as a professional developer? Then, you will need to learn about Bootstrap 4, which is a client-side CSS framework that helps create good-looking sites with little effort. In web development, developers and designers play very different roles. ‘Bootstrap 4 - Exploring New Features’ is a free online course that analyzes the exciting features and functionalities of the framework, and takes you through how to build a responsive website using the enhanced features of Bootstrap 4. This short course begins by taking you through the processes of downloading Bootstrap 4 and creating relevant folders. You see how the folders on ‘CSS’, ‘img’ and ‘js’ are arranged in the Bootstrap folder. Learn how to operate an editor that will be used in building your responsive site. Identify a variety of editors that can be employed and what informs the choice of selecting a particular one. The course shows you how to download an editor, unzip it, and get it ready for use in developing a website. Learn how to recommend the right extensions to use when creating any type of file and master the process of linking files together when working with an editor.

Furthermore, the material demonstrates how to link HTML, CSS and Bootstrap files. Bootstrap 4 supports several Internet browsers and outlines their compatibility. You will learn how to open up the head tags and body tags, and study the applications and functionalities of navigation bars in developing a website. The course also provides an in-depth discussion of how to develop a jumbotron, including how to insert background images. 

The course explains how Bootstrap 4, by supporting Internet Explorer 9, has been able to embrace some much-loved CSS modules. You will see how Bootstrap 4 has been able to clean up its components with the removal of the classic well, panel, and thumbnail components. Be introduced to the new card components and their unique characteristics. Finally, you will be taken through how to download the Microsoft Visual C++ component. If you are interested in a simple and free front-end framework for faster and easier web development, then this course would be a great fit for you. Are you a developer in the quest to update your professional skills? Then, enrol in this free online course today and get the opportunity to use Bootstrap 4 to easily create responsive and visually appealing web designs.
